--- title: "Math 201" subtitle: "Elementary Statistics" format: revealjs: width: 1200 scrollable: false footer: m201.inqs.info/lectures/1a theme: [default, styles.scss] navigation-mode: vertical controls-layout: edges controls-tutorial: true slide-number: true pointer: pointerSize: 32 incremental: false chalkboard: theme: whiteboard chalk-width: 4 knitr: opts_chunk: echo: true eval: true message: false code-fold: true warnings: false comment: "#>" revealjs-plugins: - pointer filters: - reveal-header - code-fullscreen - reveal-auto-agenda editor: source --- ## Slides [www.inqs.info/m2012_f25/c/1a](https://www.inqs.info/m201_s26/lectures/1a) # Introductions ## Introductions - San Bernardino, CA - CSU Monterey Bay - BS Biology - San Diego State University - Master's in Public Health - UC Riverside - PhD in Applied Statistics ## Introductions ::: nonincremental - Name - Year - Major - Fun Fact - Career Goal ::: # Embedded Peer Educator ## EPE - Jasmine Torres - This is my 7th year at CSUCI - Triple major in Math (triple emphasis pure, applied, and statistics), Computer Science, and Physics. - Minoring in philosophy and cybersecurity. # Early Success Module ## Assignments :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} - Learner Info Survey - Using the Study Cycle Efficiently ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} - Bloom's Taxonomy - The Feynman Technique ::: :::: # Class Setup ## Class Setup - Participation - Notebook Assignments - Video Assignments - Classwork Assignments - Exams - Extra Credit ## Study Expectations For every 1 unit of class you take, you are expected to spend ~3 hours outside of class for the course. ## Syllabus [www.inqs.info/m201_s26/syllabus](https://www.inqs.info/m201_s26/syllabus.html) ## R Programming This utilized the R programming to conduct data analysis. R is a powerful tool that allows you to program complex tasks. Learning R is difficult, but it is the best teacher to teach you how to overcome challenges. Don't give up when it gets hard and seek out help when needed. # Statistics Activity ## When do you use statistics? ## What is the difference between math and stats? # Use of Generative AI ## Use of Generative AI The use of generative artificial intelligence (AI) to complete any part or all of an assignment/exam is strictly prohibited in this class. This includes, but not limited to, ChatGPT, Claude, Meta AI, and Google Gemini. ::: fragment You may use AI to enhance you understanding of the material. ::: ::: fragment You may not upload any course material to any AI platforms such as ChatGPT, Claude, Meta AI, and Google Gemini. Exceptions are allowed for [DASS](https://www.csuci.edu/dass/)-approved services. ::: ## Use of AI There are consequences when you use of AI: - Educational Mislearning - Trusting AI - Stolen Work - Privacy Concerns - Environmental Impacts - Working Exploitation ## Educational Mislearning The purpose of this class, and college, is for you to learn about critical thinking skills and perseverance. Using AI will only teach you how to get an answer, which may or may not be correct. ::: fragment You will not develop the skills needed to problem solve a challenge. Additionally, developing grit is essential to become successful in college and life. There is no easy way out and AI is an illusion to your success in life. ::: ::: fragment To learn something, it requires hours of work! If not years! ::: ## Trusting AI When using AI, you must acknowledge its limitations: ::: incremental - Responses provided may be incorrect - Responses may not be fair - Companies may manipulate responses and/or terms of service for their benefit - Companies may not have your best interst in mind ::: ::: fragment **You should always proceed with caution utilizing these tools!** ::: ## Stolen Work ::: fragment Additionally, all these individuals are not receiving any royalties for the work to be used in creating generative AI models. ::: ::: fragment [Inside Higher Ed](https://www.insidehighered.com/news/faculty-issues/research/2024/07/29/taylor-francis-ai-deal-sets-worrying-precedent) and [The New Yorker](https://www.newyorker.com/culture/infinite-scroll/is-ai-art-stealing-from-artists) highlight individual's concern of their work being used to train AI models. ::: ## Privacy Concerns The use of generative AI raises concerns of what data is being harvested from us, possibly without informed consent. ::: fragment When you used any large language models, you do not know what information is being harvested from you. ::: ::: fragment Do you want to upload your thoughts and ideas to a company that can monetize, and possibly exploit. ::: ::: fragment Does your Professors consent with you uploading their assignments to large language models? ::: ::: fragment Stanford provided a [report](https://hai.stanford.edu/news/privacy-ai-era-how-do-we-protect-our-personal-information) highlighting the risks of our personal data use in large language models. ::: ## Environmental Impact In order to run these large language models, companies need to use a large amounts of energy. This is because large servers are needed to both train and execute a model. ::: fragment The [LA Times](https://www.latimes.com/opinion/story/2024-08-15/editorial-generative-ai-is-a-leading-contributor-to-our-energy-consumption-how-will-this-impact-our-climate) reports the potential impact that running AI models in California. ::: ::: fragment Additionally, [Time](https://time.com/6987773/ai-data-centers-energy-usage-climate-change/) reports that a ChatGPT query uses ten times more energy than a Google search query, and global AI demands can consume of 1 trillion gallons of water by 2027. ::: ::: fragment There are also environmental justice questions about where these data centers are constructed. ::: ## Worker Exploitation The [Washington Post](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2023/08/28/scale-ai-remotasks-philippines-artificial-intelligence/) and Time ([Article 1](https://time.com/6147458/facebook-africa-content-moderation-employee-treatment/) and [Article 2](https://time.com/6247678/openai-chatgpt-kenya-workers/)) reported that AI companies utilize "digital sweatshops" to classify data points for model training. ::: fragment There is a human cost from the Global South, both financially and mentally, to develop the AI models for users in the United States and Europe. ::: ::: fragment We must be conscious consumers and demand more from these companies to provide safe working conditions and livable wages. ::: ## Is Using AI Bad? ::: fragment Yes/No/IDK ::: ::: fragment But, we need to acknowledge the consequences of using AI! ::: ::: fragment And, we need to demand companies to create and implement AI in an ethical manner! ::: # Surveys ## Intro Form [Form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdCOoa1nw4mrFA9svC12LNDSh618MEijHFE8Rcop2Nb0BJgAQ/viewform?usp=publish-editor) ![](img/qr-code.jpg){fig-align="center"} ## First Survey [Survey](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScYV9qxgaxv53MmQtxUtL26os_L7LsLaCgQKx8zyQ4vA13TaA/viewform?usp=publish-editor) ![](img/qr-code-1.jpg){fig-align="center"} # Extra Credits ## Extra Credit 1

## Extra Credit 2

## Extra Credit 3

# Field Trip

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
